hero.title: Secrets Management for
hero.description: Securely manage secrets and dispatch them to AI agents with scoped access, short-lived tokens, and complete audit trails. Single binary, no server, no accounts.

features.title: Built for the Agent Age
features.description: Traditional password managers weren't built for autonomous agents. Authy bridges the gap between security and automation.

encryptedVault.title: Encrypted Vault
encryptedVault.description: Single age-encrypted file. Secrets are stored in MessagePack format for speed and security. No metadata leakage.

scopedPolicies.title: Scoped Policies
scopedPolicies.description: Glob-based allow/deny rules per agent scope. Policies are stored inside the encrypted vault and are tamper-proof.

sessionTokens.title: Session Tokens
sessionTokens.description: Short-lived, read-only HMAC tokens. Scannable prefixes for leak detection and instant revocation capability.

subprocessInjection.title: Subprocess Injection
subprocessInjection.description: Inject secrets directly as environment variables. Secrets never appear in parent process environment or shell history.

auditLogging.title: Audit Logging
auditLogging.description: Tamper-evident JSONL append-only log with HMAC chaining. Track every secret access: who, what, when.

headlessOperation.title: Headless Operation
headlessOperation.description: Works entirely without interactive prompts. Perfect for CI/CD pipelines, automation scripts, and agents.

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.description: Get up and running in seconds. Authy is a single binary with zero dependencies. Designed to be pipe-friendly and automation-ready.

comparison.title: Why Authy?
comparison.description: Designed specifically for the unique constraints of local-first AI agents.

securityBanner.title: Stop leaking secrets in your shell history.
securityBanner.description: Even {{code}} can leak data. Authy's TUI ensures secrets entered in the admin interface never touch your shell history or process arguments.

footer.description: Give your agents the secrets they need, not the keys to the kingdom. Secure, scoped, and local-first.
